Package com.rds_software.customers.menarini.projects.odp.frontend.forms Description

User interface forms for ODP management.

Overview

This package contains form classes that represent the user interface screens in the ODP system. Each form extends the RDS SimpleForm framework and provides a complete UI page with fields, grids, actions, and state management.

Forms

OdpSearchForm

OdpSearchForm - Search and browse ODPs

  • Purpose: Search for ODPs using various filter criteria
  • Features:
    • Filter by company, state, date ranges, owner
    • Sortable results grid
    • Pagination support
    • Row selection to view/edit ODPs
  • Actions: New ODP, Edit ODP, View Details

OdpTasksForm

OdpTasksForm - View ODPs assigned to current user

  • Purpose: Display ODPs requiring action from current user
  • Features:
    • Shows ODPs where user is assignee
    • Automatically filters by user
    • Excludes certain states (TEMPLATE, PAYABLE, REJECTED)
    • Sortable task grid
  • Actions: Edit ODP, Open for Approval

OdpDetailForm

OdpDetailForm - Create or edit ODP details

  • Purpose: Input/modify ODP data
  • Features:
    • All ODP fields (company, currency, supplier, amounts, dates, etc.)
    • Field validation
    • Conditional field visibility based on company
    • Read-only mode for non-editable states
  • Modes:
    • Create: Empty form for new ODP
    • Edit: Pre-filled form for existing ODP
    • View: Read-only display
  • Actions: Create, Update, Submit for Approval, Cancel

OdpApprovalForm

OdpApprovalForm - Approve or reject ODPs

  • Purpose: Review and approve/reject payment orders
  • Features:
    • Read-only ODP details
    • Authorization flow grid showing approval history
    • Notes field for approval comments
    • Password confirmation
  • Actions: Approve, Reject, Cancel

OdpChoseCompanyForm

OdpChoseCompanyForm - Select company before creating ODP

  • Purpose: Select company context for new ODP
  • Features:
    • Company dropdown filtered by user permissions
    • Sets company context for subsequent detail form
  • Actions: Confirm, Cancel

Form Architecture

Base Class

OdpAbstractForm provides common functionality:

  • Access to OdpApp and its services
  • Common utility methods
  • Shared initialization logic

Form Components

Each form typically contains:

  • EntitiesData - Data container with ERParams for form fields
  • DataGrid - Tabular display of ODPs with sorting/pagination
  • Actions - User operations available on the form
  • Validators - Field-level and form-level validation logic

EntitiesData Classes

Each form defines an inner EntitiesData class:

  • OdpSearchFormEntitiesData - Search filter fields
  • OdpDetailFormEntitiesData - ODP detail fields
  • OdpApprovalFormEntitiesData - Approval form fields
  • OdpChoseCompanyFormEntitiesData - Company selection fields

DataGrid Classes

Grid components for displaying ODP lists:

  • OdpSearchResultsDataGrid - Search results with all columns
  • OdpTasksResultDataGrid - Task list with relevant columns
  • AuthorizationGrid - Approval history timeline

Form Lifecycle

Initialization

  1. SimpleForm constructor called
  2. createEntitiesData() creates form fields
  3. initializeFormActions() registers actions
  4. initializeForm() performs additional setup

Data Loading

  1. Form becomes active state
  2. loadData() populates fields from domain model
  3. Mappers transform domain objects to form data
  4. ERParams update their display values

User Interaction

  1. User modifies fields or clicks action button
  2. Framework validates fields
  3. Action's getNextStateID() executes
  4. Business logic runs
  5. Navigation to next form (or refresh current)

Navigation Flow

Create ODP Workflow

 SearchForm â†’ [New ODP] â†’ ChoseCompanyForm â†’ [Confirm] â†’ DetailForm â†’ [Create] â†’ TasksForm

Edit ODP Workflow

 SearchForm/TasksForm â†’ [Edit] â†’ DetailForm â†’ [Update] â†’ TasksForm

Approval Workflow

 TasksForm â†’ [Open Approval] â†’ ApprovalForm â†’ [Approve/Reject] â†’ TasksForm

Data Binding

Form to Domain


 // In action's getNextStateID()
 Odp odp = new Odp();
 OdpMapper.fromFormData(detailForm.getSimpleEntitiesData(), odp);
 service.createOdp(odp, userId);

Domain to Form


 // In form's loadData()
 Odp odp = service.findOdpById(odpId);
 OdpMapper.toFormData(odp, getSimpleEntitiesData());

Common Patterns

Accessing Service


 public class OdpSomeForm extends OdpAbstractForm {
     protected void someMethod() throws Exception {
         IOdpService service = getSimpleApplication().getIOdpService();
         OdpUser user = getSimpleApplication().getOdpUser();
         // Use service
     }
 }

Grid Refresh


 public void resetDataGrid() {
     dataGrid.reset(); // Clears cached data
     // Grid will reload on next display
 }

Field Visibility


 // Conditional field display
 OdpCompany company = getCompany();
 if (company.getCode().equals("001")) {
     someField.setVisible(true);
 }
